fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.config

Interface IConfigResource


  • public interface IConfigResource
    Represents persistent configuration resource types other than default configuration stores. Unlike the default key-value configuration stores, the contents of configuration resource are opaque to the configuration service, which does not define how to read, write, or expose as configuration resource data.

    Thread safety: implementations are not required to be safe for concurrent read/write access to the resource, so appropriate external locking should be used.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IConfigStore, IConfigService.getConfigResource(String, ResourceType)

    • Method Detail

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        Indicates if the resource exists in persistent storage. The default implementation of persistent storage stores resources as files in the configuration folder.
        Returns:
        true if the resource exists, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • as

        <T> T as(Class<T> representation)
  throws IOException
        Gets the resource as an instance of the specified type, where such a conversion is available. Using String.class as a parameter is the default supported conversion. Other conversions depend upon the version of ViewShell and included libraries; such conversions may not be supported in future versions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type parameter of the representation.
        Parameters:
        representation - the exact type of the required representation, such as String.class.
        Returns:
        an instance of the specific type. If the requested conversion is not available, an IOException will be thrown.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs creating the representation, or if the conversion is not supported.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        exists(), getInputStream()

      • getInputStream

        InputStream getInputStream()
                    throws IOException
        Gets a stream for reading the contents of the resource.
        Returns:
        a stream to read from.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a stream cannot be obtained.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        exists(), as(Class)

      • getOutputStream

        OutputStream getOutputStream()
                      throws IOException
        Gets a stream for creating or replacing the contents of the resource. The stream is transparently buffered into a temporary file, which will be moved into place (overwriting the existing file) only if no exceptions are thrown, when OutputStream.close() is invoked.
        Returns:
        a stream to write to.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a stream cannot be obtained.
        Since:
        1.0

      • delete

        void delete()
     throws IOException
        Deletes the resource if it exists. Does nothing if not.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the resource exists and cannot be deleted.
        Since:
        1.0

      • addConfigResourceListener

        void addConfigResourceListener(IConfigResourceEventListener listener)
        Adds a listener for notifications of resource state changes. Changes include creation, modification, and deletion.
        Parameters:
        listener - the non-null listener to add.
        Since:
        1.0

      • removeConfigResourceListener

        void removeConfigResourceListener(IConfigResourceEventListener listener)
        Removes a listener for notification of resource state changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the non-null listener to remove.
        Since:
        1.0
